page.title: 08The School. Middleton. (3)
page.content: We spoke to the{headmaster}of the school. He obviously enjoyed teaching at Middleton and he told us that the great advantage from his point of view was that he could get to know all the children really well.The children also benefitted from a friendly atmosphere with everyone knowing everyone else. The headmaster thought that there were no inherent disadvantages in a small primary school but he did think that many children found it difficult when they transferred to a large secondary school. The continued existence of a school seems to be important to the continuation of village facilities. One resident at North Runcton told us that the closing of the school had been the decisive step in the decline of village facilities there.
